alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Laurel; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 7:12AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Laurel, Jackson and northeastern Rockcastle Counties through 745 AM EDT... At 712 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Morrill, or 11 miles northeast of Mount Vernon, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Threelinks, Clover Bottom, Bummer, Kerby Knob and Hisel around 715 AM EDT. Eglon, Goochland, Johnetta, Sandgap, Dudley Station, Hummel and Orlando around 720 AM EDT. Loam, Cooksburg, Robinet, Collingsworth, Waneta, Donaro, Withers and Sinks around 725 AM EDT. McKee, Dango, Hurley, Horse Lick, Jep Hill and Gauley around 730 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Middlefork, Carico, Ardery, Shop Branch, Cruise, Templer, Mershons, Lamero, Atkinstown, Bradshaw, Deese, Parrot, Dabolt, Eberle, Olin and Gray Hawk. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 65 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
